citation.article-title: Moryella indoligenes gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic bacterium isolated from clinical specimens
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Moryella (Mo.ry.elâ€²la. L. fem. dim. ending -ella; N.L. fem. n. Moryella named in honour of the French microbiologist Francine Mory, who has contributed to our understanding of anaerobes).
Cells are Gram-variable after staining but structurally Gram-positive, elongated, non-motile rods with pointed ends.
Cells may lose their colour easily.
Strictly anaerobic, without growth under microaerophilic or aerobic conditions.
Catalase and urease reactions are negative.
The major metabolic end products are acetic, butyric and lactic acids.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the C. coccoides rRNA cluster (rRNA cluster XIVa; Collins et al., 1994).
The type species is Moryella indoligenes.
